nodes.bodyText: This looks a little odd to me. How about renaming this to something like assertSupportedPayloadType and throw an exception holding a description in case of an invalid payload?

Throwing an exception in that message doesn't fit the use case of the Command class and just adds clutter there.
I've renamed the method to getUnsupportedPayloadReason now (returning an Optional).
When the need for a assertSupportedPayloadTyp method arises, we can add that, simply invoking getUnsupportedPayloadReason internally.
Is this method being used anywhere else? If this is a very Command specific requirement, then we could also simply embed this method into the Command class. WDYT?

Ok, I've moved the method to the Command class.
I've also updated the new org.eclipse.hono.adapter.client.command.Command class.
